column1: A slipped capital femoral epiphysisfemoral epiphysis is a separation of the ball of the hip joint from the thigh bone (femur) at the upper growing end (growth plate) of the bone.

It is more common in: - Growing children ages 11 to 15, especially boys - Children who are obese - Children who are growing rapidly Children with hormone imbalances caused by other conditions are at higher risk for this disorder.
This disorder is linked to a greater risk of osteoarthritis later in life.
If your child has ongoing pain or other symptoms of this disorder, have the child lie down right away and stay still until you get medical help.
Weight control for obese children may be helpful.
